channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: A $444 Billion 'Fat Finger' Trade Crashed Stocks. Now Citigroup Is Paying the Price.
item.description: Citigroup agreed to pay U.K. regulators $78 million, after a botched 2022 order to sell shares caused a brief “flash crash” in European stocks.

item.title: Why Microsoft Is Spreading Its AI Bets to PCs
item.description: The software giant’s stock has lagged behind peers as investors worry about AI’s costs—and time to payoff.

item.title: OPEC leaves forecast for demand-growth unchanged
Gold's Latest Allure? It's Sanctions-Proof
item.description: Buying from central banks, particularly from China, can keep the gold rally going even if anxious individual investors don’t jump in.

item.title: Monster Beverage’s stock up 1.4% after company announces Dutch auction tender offer for up to $3 billion of its own stock
Risky Bonds Join the Everything Rally
item.description: The premium paid by high-yield debt falls to near pandemic-era lows.

item.title: Cigna’s stock jumps 2.7% after earnings beat estimates and company raises guidance
Crypto Takes Aim at 2024 Elections
item.description: Coinbase, Kraken and others are fighting for survival after a regulatory crackdown.

item.title: Dropbox says cybersecurity incident is unlikely to have a material impact on operations
